title: Xyrichtys sanctaehelenae
data:
Xyrichtys sanctaehelenae, the yellow razorfish, is a species of marine ray-finned fish from the family Labridae, the wrasses. It is found in the central Atlantic Ocean.[2] This species reaches a length of 23.3 cm (9.2 in).[3] The fish is named in honor of the island of St. Helens in the Atlantic.
[4] This Labridae article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
